Utterance: Hi, it’s Ellie again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I’ve been okay, a bit anxious about the hearing, but I did manage to write down my feelings.
That’s great to hear! How did the journaling go for you?
It was really helpful. I wrote about my worries and even some positive things that have happened.
That’s wonderful! Reflecting on the positive can really shift our mindset. What positives did you write about?
I wrote about the small gigs I’ve had and how nice it was to reconnect with an old client.
That’s fantastic! It’s important to celebrate those wins, no matter how small. How did reaching out feel?
It felt good! She was really supportive and encouraged me to keep pushing forward.
That’s so encouraging! It sounds like you’re building a supportive network. Have you thought about any other connections you’d like to make?
I’ve been thinking about reaching out to some local photographers for potential collaborations.
That’s a brilliant idea! Collaborations can open up new opportunities.
Yes, I think it could be a fun way to create something new.
Absolutely! How about your daughters? Have you been able to give them some space as we discussed?
Yes, I’ve tried to plan some solo activities. I went to an art class and it was amazing!
That’s wonderful! How did it feel to engage in something creative?
It was refreshing. I forgot how much I loved painting. It brought back a lot of joy.
I’m so glad to hear that! It’s great that you’re rediscovering your creative side.
Yes, it feels like I’m reconnecting with myself.
That’s an important part of healing. How has your anxiety been regarding the disability hearing?
It’s still there, but I’ve been trying to manage it with meditation and journaling.
Those are excellent strategies. How do you feel about the upcoming hearing now?
I’m still nervous, but I feel a bit more prepared. Writing helped me organize my thoughts.
That’s a great approach! Remember, it’s okay to feel anxious. How about practicing some positive affirmations leading up to the hearing?
That could be helpful. I’ll try to remind myself of my strengths.
Absolutely! Focusing on your strengths can empower you. What strengths would you like to highlight?
I’m resilient and creative. Despite everything, I keep pushing forward.
Those are powerful strengths! Keep reminding yourself of that resilience.
Thank you, Ellie. I really appreciate your support.
I’m here for you! Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think I’m good for now. I’m feeling more hopeful.
That’s great to hear! Let’s keep building on that hope.
Yes, I’m excited to see what comes next.
Me too! Let’s check in again next week.
Sounds good! Bye for now!
Bye! Take care!
